alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:27AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BEDFORD AND SOMERSET COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM EDT... At 221 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jeannette to Connellsville to near Uniontown to 15 miles east of Morgantown. Additional strong thunderstorms were developing ahead of this line, near Seven Springs and Laurel Ridge State park. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts out of the west up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Somerset, Windber, Bedford, Meyersdale, Berlin, Clearville, Everett, Friedens, Boswell, Davidsville, Central City, Paint, Jerome, Buffalo Mills, Scalp Level, Acosta, Ursina, New Centerville, Lake Gordon and Cessna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
